issues.description: The problem statement specifies a static method named acceptSupplyDelivery(String, int, int) in SealSaloon, but the solution defines it as receiveDelivery(String, int, int). This name mismatch will confuse students about which method to implement and causes tests for acceptSupplyDelivery to fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the solutionâ€™s receiveDelivery method to acceptSupplyDelivery (or update the problem statement to use receiveDelivery) so that method names are consistent across specification and implementation.

issues.description: Problem statement specifies a static method named 'acceptSupplyDelivery' in SealSaloon, but the solution implements this functionality under the name 'receiveDelivery', creating a direct naming mismatch for the same concept and confusing students when mapping requirements to code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename 'receiveDelivery' to 'acceptSupplyDelivery' in the SealSaloon solution so that the method name matches the problem specification and test expectations.
